item.title: [OSWALPUMPS] Oswal Pumps Secures Rs. 119.92 Crore Solar Pump Order under PM-KUSUM B Scheme
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Oswal Pumps Ltd has received a Letter of Award from Karnataka Renewable Energy Development Limited for 214 Surface Solar Agriculture Pumps Set and 3049 Submersible Solar Agriculture Pump Sets for the entire state of Karnataka under Component-B of PM-KUSUM scheme. The total value of the pumps is approximately Rs. 119.92 Crore (inclusive of GST). The order involves design, manufacture, supply, transport, installation, testing, and commissioning of solar agriculture pumps, along with system warranty, repair, maintenance, and remote monitoring for 5 years. The installation and commissioning, along with RMS integration and submission of invoices and documents, are to be carried out on or before March 31, 2026.

  • Oswal Pumps has secured an order worth approximately Rs. 119.92 Crore from Karnataka Renewable Energy Development Limited under the PM-KUSUM B Scheme.
  • The order involves the supply and installation of 3,263 Off-Grid DC Solar Photovoltaic Water Pumping Systems across Karnataka.
  • The pumps will be in 3 HP, 5 HP, 7.5 HP, and 10 HP capacities, supporting sustainable irrigation and promoting renewable energy in the agricultural sector.
  • This order strengthens Oswal Pumps' position as a leading player in the solar pumping solutions segment and reflects its strong execution capabilities and manufacturing expertise.
  • The project is expected to further strengthen Oswal Pumps' presence in Karnataka and enable deeper market penetration.

item.title: [BPCL] Bharat Petroleum Subsidiary Discovers Oil in Abu Dhabi's Onshore Block 1, Investing USD 166 Million
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL) announced that its subsidiary, Bharat PetroResources Limited (BPRL), discovered oil in Onshore Block 1, Abu Dhabi, through a 50:50 Special Purpose Vehicle, Urja Bharat Pte Limited (UBPL). The discovery follows the award of the exploration concession in March 2019 and a successful exploration phase with a total investment of nearly USD 166 million. The concession agreement covers 6,162 square kilometers, granting UBPL 100% concession rights. The first oil discovery was made in the XN-76 well, confirming the presence of unconventional oil resources in the Shilaif formation. BPRL is optimistic about the well results and looking forward to establishing the economic deliverability of wells during the appraisal phase. Additionally, oil was discovered in the exploration well XN-79 02S in the Habshan reservoir. These discoveries will contribute to BPRL's efforts towards India's energy security.

  • Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd's subsidiary, Bharat PetroResources Limited (BPRL), discovers oil in Onshore Block 1, Abu Dhabi.

item.title: [IOC] Indian Oil Corporation Makes Significant Oil Discoveries in Abu Dhabi's Onshore Block 1
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) and Bharat PetroResources Limited, through their Special Purpose Vehicle Urja Bharat Pte Limited (UBPL), have made significant oil discoveries in the Onshore Block 1 Exploration Concession in Abu Dhabi. The first discovery was made in the Unconventional Shilaif play in XN-76 exploratory well, which flowed light crude oil at surface from the Shilaif formation after successful hydrofracking operations. The second discovery was made in the Habshan reservoir in the exploratory well XN- 79 02S. Both companies are positive about these discoveries and are looking forward to appraising and potentially developing these finds. This is a significant achievement for both parent companies as international operators.

  • Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat PetroResources Limited make first oil discovery in the Unconventional Shilaif play in XN-76 exploratory well
  • Successful hydrofracking operations lead to flow of light crude oil at surface from the Shilaif formation
  • Second oil discovery made in the Habshan reservoir in the exploratory well XN- 79 02S
  • Companies looking forward to appraising and potentially developing these discoveries
  • Positive achievement for both parent companies as international operators
